title: Key takeaways from Emmanuel Macron's interview
summary: Just a few days before the opening of the Paris 2024 Olympics – and shortly after the Nouveau Front Populaire's proposal to appoint Lucie Castets as prime minister –, the head of state was the guest on France 2 and Radio France on Tuesday evening.

title: Harris, buoyed by support from Democratic Congressional leaders, launches first campaign rally
summary: American vice president Kamala Harris, the overwhelming frontrunner for the Democratic nomination who is raking in endorsements and donations as well as pledged delegates, is also narrowly trailing Republican flag-bearer Trump in a survey released Tuesday, July 23.

title: UK royal family announces roadmap toward achieving net-zero emissions
summary: In a communiqué issued in the early morning of Wednesday, July 24, 2024, the Crown unveils its latest strategy to achieve sustainability goals.

title: 'Venezuelans are ready for a change'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' Edmundo Gonzalez, the opposition candidate facing Nicolas Maduro, reiterated that 'the government has lost its popular base' and said he is carrying 'a message of tolerance and reconciliation.'

title: China mediates between Palestinian Hamas and Fatah in 'Beijing Declaration'
summary: The two Palestinian factions signed in Beijing a reconciliation agreement, the groups said Tuesday, July 23. It's the latest attempt at resolving a longstanding rivalry that looms over any potential vision for the rule of Gaza, with China believing a role for Hamas in the post-war period cannot be dismissed.

title: Inside Paris's vast security operation for the Olympics
summary: Some 30,000 police officers and gendarmes will walk the streets in Paris every day throughout the Olympics as the capital's police deploys all of its resources to prevent various threats, from terrorist attacks to cyber crime.

title: In Ireland, power consumption by data centers surpasses that of residential homes
summary: Ireland's boom in data centers and tech companies has been powered by its policy of low corporate taxation.

title: Director of the Super-Novae NGO: 'Objectively, the entire Gaza Strip is destroyed'
summary: Alexandre Chatillon describes survival conditions in the enclave, which he visited in early July.

title: Haiti's capital in the grip of gangs: 'We eat well two days a week'
summary: Port-au-Prince is 80% controlled by armed groups who terrorize the population. Several tens of thousands of inhabitants, driven from their homes by these gangs, are crammed into makeshift camps where they suffer from hunger.

title: Democrat Bob Menendez resigns his Senate seat following corruption conviction
summary: The New Jersey Senator seat was already up for election on November 5, and Democrats have nominated US Representative Andy Kim to face Republican Curtis Bashaw.

title: Paris 2024: 'Resistance is the shared history of refugee athletes'
summary: In an interview, Afghanistan's Masomah Ali Zada described the Olympic refugee team, of which she is the mission leader, as an 'example of hope' and 'a symbol of unity.' Thirty-seven representatives will be present at the Games in Paris.

title: Secret Service director steps down after Trump assassination attempt
summary: Kimberly Cheatle announced her decision in an email to staff one day after a hearing before the House Oversight Committee where she faced criticism for failing to protect Donald Trump at a rally in Pennsylvania.

title: Paris 2024: French PM says 6 drones per day intercepted near Olympic sites
summary: Gabriel Attal explained that the flying vehicles were often used by 'tourists wanting to take pictures,' but, as they are banned, French air defense staff would 'quickly intercept' them, and their operators would be arrested.

title: Paris 2024: During the Olympics, Paris homeowners' dreams of hitting the 'Airbnb jackpot'
summary: The number of apartments in the capital listed on Airbnb skyrocketed in just one year. The Olympics convinced hundreds of thousands of Parisians to sublet their properties at high prices, but not all found takers.

title: Overtourism: Iconic Brittany island limits number of visitors
summary: From July 22 to August 23, only 4,700 visitors will be able to access Bréhat between 8:30 am and 2:30 pm, a measure closely scrutinized by the region's other islands.

title: Vance questions Harris' legitimacy
summary: Donald Trump's running mate lashed out at the US vice president, who is poised to secure the Democratic Party's nomination in the race for the White House. He questioned Kamala Harris' patriotism, alluding to her Indian-Jamaican origins.

title: 2024 Olympics: A medal hope for Japan goes up in smoke
summary: Shoko Miyata, 19, had to withdraw from the Paris Olympic Games as captain of the Japanese gymnastics team. Her crime: Having smoked and drunk alcohol, which is forbidden to under-20s in Japan.

title: Macron presses against extradition for anti-whaling activist Paul Watson
summary: After the founder of the activist group Sea Shepherd was arrested in Greenland under a Japanese warrant, Greens MPs, celebrities, and petitions have urged Macron to call for his release.

title: Macron says no new government until 'mid-August,' declining left-wing proposal for PM
summary: The left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire alliance backed Lucie Castets, the finance director at Paris City Hall, to become France's prime minister. President Emmanuel Macron said he would not appoint a new prime minister until after the Paris Olympics.
